<lb/>Paper stock: London Superfine wove.<lb/><lb/>Brontë seems to have anticipated this very criticism. At the outset of this late <lb/>expansion, her narrator addresses the novel’s readers as follows: “Yet again, a <lb/>passage from the blank book, if you like, reader; if you don’t like it, pass it <lb/>over:—.”<hi rend="sup">151</hi> The device, indeed, feels most contrived at this particular point of<lb/>
<hi rend="sup">151.</hi> <hi rend="italic">Shirley</hi>, Clarendon edition, 713.<lb/>
